title: Rajya Sabha MP Mahendra Bhatt re-elected Uttarakhand BJP chief
content: This time too, the BJP has chosen a Thakur as CM, and a Brahmin as the president of the State unit; the two communities constitute over half the voters in Uttarakhand

title: Trinamool urges Election Commission to use 2024 as base year for voter list revision
content: Party delegation flags birth certificate clause, voter data surge; seeks limits on booth access for central forces

title: Major revamp planned for Kukke Subrahmanya temple in Dakshina Kannada
content: Key projects include a new Ashlesha Bali Puja Mandira in Tulsi Garden and an Annadasoha Bhavan to serve 5,000 devotees daily.

title: MHA appeals against J&K HC order to repatriate housewife deported to Pakistan after 38 years in India on long-term visa
content: Petitioner’s daughter says the facts were distorted to push her mother out of India in the wake of the Pahalgam attack; Justice Rahul Bharti directs MHA to comply with order as it has not been stayed despite appeal

title: Karnataka monsoon: June sees 8% more rainfall; south interior districts register huge shortfall
content: Belagavi in the North-Interior Karnataka (NIK) meteorological subdivision received the most surplus rainfall with a 98% departure from normal

title: Bandstand in Lalbagh dismantled for restoration
content: The structure was set up by the British in the year 1870 and has since hosted many military and police bands, which played there

title: Surgeries resume in Thiruvananthapuram MCH’s Urology department
content: Surgical procedures at the Urology department had come to a standstill after the purchase process for the Lithoclast machine’s probe through the hospital development society had been inordinately delayed

title: Union Cabinet approves a four-lane highway section to facilitate easy access to Rameswaram
content: The Paramakudi-Ramanathapuram section will cost ₹1,853 crore. It will also connect key economic, social, and logistics nodes across southern Tamil Nadu, says the Union Ministry of Road Transport and Highways

title: From delivering food to delivering dialogues, the stages in the life of a woman theatre artiste from Kolkata
content: Sangita Sarkar, an alumna of the National School of Drama, is directing Moonlight, an adaptation of veteran Marathi playwright Mahesh Elkunchwar’s Sonata

title: NDA MPs walk out protesting Medha Patkar’s presence at meet of House panel on rural development
content: Officials from three Ministries and 10 civil society experts, including Ms. Patkar, attended the meet to review implementation of land acquisition law

title: Cabinet approves ₹1 lakh crore corpus for galvanising private investment in R&D
content: The funds would however be provided only for products that have reached a certain level of development and market potential

title: Priyadarshini award presented to rapper Vedan
content: He donates the cash prize of ₹1 lakh back to the Priyadarshini Public Library, which instituted the award, to purchase books

title: Censor board’s ban on JSK an attack on creative freedom: Saji Cherian
content: If this is the fate of a film starring a Union Minister, what awaits ordinary artists? asks the Minister

title: Big jobs boost! Cabinet approves Rs 1.07 lakh cr scheme to create 3.5 cr jobs
content: The Union Cabinet has approved the Employment Linked Incentive (ELI) Scheme, allocating ₹99,446 crore to generate over 3.5 crore jobs within two years. New employees will receive wage incentives, while employers get support for creating additional jobs, especially in manufacturing.

title: 'One Big Beautiful Bill': Senate passes Trump’s spending bill; JD Vance cast deciding vote
content: The US Senate has approved President Trump's $4.5 trillion spending bill, extending tax cuts, increasing military spending, and funding border security. The legislation, expected to add $3.3 trillion to the national debt, now heads to the House amid Republican concerns. The bill faces opposition over healthcare cuts and spending levels, potentially impacting millions and sparking internal party divisions.

title: '20–30 bullets fired': Iskcon temple targeted in US; India urges action
content: The Indian Consulate in San Francisco has condemned recent shootings at the Iskcon Sri Sri Radha Krishna Temple in Spanish Fork, Utah, urging swift action to bring the perpetrators to justice. The temple, known for its annual Holi Festival, suffered damage from 20 to 30 bullets fired over several days.

title: What brought down AI 171 plane in Ahmedabad? Simulation puts focus on technical failure
content: Air India plane crash: Investigators are exploring potential simultaneous engine failures as the cause of the Air India Boeing 787 crash in Ahmedabad, which killed all but one onboard. Simulations suggest that landing gear and wing flap positions alone wouldn't have caused the crash.

title: Watch: Vaibhav Suryavanshi heaves fire with bat; England yet level series
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi's steady 45 wasn't enough as India narrowly lost to England by one wicket in a thrilling second Youth ODI at Hove, levelling the series 1-1. Despite useful contributions from Vihaan Malhotra, Rahul Kumar, and others, England's Thomas Rew's explosive 131 shifted the momentum. Sebastian Morgan's late boundary secured the win for England in a nail-biting finish.

title: ChatGPT warning: OpenAI CEO asks users not to trust AI ‘much’
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman cautions users against over-reliance on ChatGPT, highlighting its tendency to 'hallucinate' and produce unreliable information. Despite ongoing advancements and new features, Altman acknowledges the technology's limitations and emphasizes the need for transparency. He also reversed his stance on AI hardware, suggesting that current computers are inadequate for an AI-driven world.

title: 'In constructive custody': Mehul Choksi opposes ED’s fugitive tag; cites Belgium arrest
content: Mehul Choksi, accused in the PNB scam, contests being labeled a fugitive economic offender, citing his arrest in Belgium at India's request. His lawyer argues he's in 'constructive custody,' undermining the FEO Act's criteria. Simultaneously, Choksi faces recovery proceedings by SEBI for insider trading violations and pursues a UK case alleging abduction by Indian operatives.

title: TN custodial death: Case handed over to CBI; CM Stalin cites transparency behind the move
content: Tamil Nadu chief minister MK Stalin has ordered a CBI investigation into the custodial death of Ajith Kumar, a temple guard who died after being detained for questioning about a jewellery theft. The decision aims to ensure a transparent probe, following concerns raised by the Madras High Court.

title: Musk-Trump renewed tension: ‘He has been humiliated by…’, says Musk’s ex-friend
content: Amidst escalating tensions between Elon Musk and Donald Trump, Philip Low, a former friend of Musk, suggests that Musk feels humiliated and will actively work to undermine the former president. This follows Musk's criticism of Trump's policies and Trump's veiled threats of deportation. Musk has hinted at escalating the conflict but is currently refraining from doing so.

title: Paulina Gretzky steps into spotlight: Teases new music track
content: Paulina Gretzky, Wayne Gretzky's daughter, is hinting at a musical comeback. She teased a new song, "If These Heels Co...", on Instagram, sparking excitement among her followers. Earlier, she shared pictures from a Nashville studio, collaborating with country singer Tyler Reeve. In December, she was seen with Reeve and Chris Young, working on a holiday project.

title: 'I nearly joined WWE, money was obscene': Ex-cricketer makes massive revelation
content: Andrew Flintoff, the former England cricket star, almost traded his bat for a wrestling ring. He engaged in serious discussions with WWE, even reaching the point of training and considering a match against The Undertaker. Ultimately, Flintoff turned down a lucrative three-year contract, prioritising his family's desire to return to the UK and choosing a career in boxing instead.

title: OpenAI is shutting down for the next week; CRO Mark Chen warns employees
content: OpenAI is temporarily closing down operations next week. This is to allow employees to rest after long work hours. Meta is trying to recruit OpenAI staff with high salary offers. Mark Chen warned OpenAI staff about Meta's tactics. Meta recently hired some OpenAI researchers. OpenAI is planning to change its compensation strategy.

title: ‘Not Tom, Dick, or Harry’: Govt rebukes Elon Musk's X; 'they are statutory functionaries'
content: The legal clash between X and the Indian government escalated in the Karnataka High Court, with X's lawyer criticizing the authorization of numerous officials to issue content takedown orders. This remark drew strong opposition from the government, which defended its statutory functionaries.

title: IND vs ENG, 2nd Test: Arshdeep hits back at troll; screenshot goes viral
content: Arshdeep Singh, part of India's Test squad in England, responded to a fan criticizing his focus with a sharp response on social media. Despite not playing in the first Test, won by England, Arshdeep was seen playfully wrestling with the bowling coach.

title: IND vs ENG: 'If Bumrah isn't playing, then ...' - Irfan makes bold claim ahead of2nd Test
content: With Jasprit Bumrah's participation in the second Test uncertain, Irfan Pathan has endorsed a 28-year-old as his replacement, highlighting his seam and swing bowling style as potentially effective in English conditions.

title: 'Answer is no': Cong rules out leadership change in Karnataka
content: Congress leader Randeep Surjewala, dispatched to Karnataka, has affirmed that Siddaramaiah will remain the Chief Minister, dismissing speculation of leadership change amidst perceived tensions with Deputy CM DK Shivakumar. Minister Priyank Kharge echoed this, stating there is no discontentment and that roles are well-defined within the party. Both Siddaramaiah and Shivakumar have publicly displayed unity, refuting rumors of rifts.

title: What is 'Einstein Visa’? What makes EB-1 visa special - why it’s in demand among Indians
content: The EB-1 "Einstein Visa," a fast track to US residency for skilled professionals, particularly from India, is gaining traction. It's designed for individuals with exceptional abilities across various fields. While demand surges, concerns rise about misleading practices like engineered media profiles. US immigration is cracking down on fraudulent applications, which can lead to permanent bans.

title: TMC minister terms Kolkata rape ‘a small incident’; BJP slams Mamata's ‘depraved regime’
content: The BJP has strongly criticized TMC after a state minister, Manas Bhuniya, seemingly downplayed the alleged gang rape of a law student in Kolkata. Bhuniya's remarks, where he referred to the incident as a 'small' one, sparked outrage. BJP leaders accused TMC of normalizing sexual violence. Bhuniya later clarified, condemning the incident and claiming his words were misrepresented.

title: UAE Golden Visa Expands: These five new professionals are eligible - do you qualify?
content: UAE expands its Golden Visa program. Five new categories are added to attract global talent. Nurses, teachers, content creators, gamers, and yacht owners are now eligible. The initiative supports UAE's Vision 2030. It aims to diversify the economy and attract skilled professionals. The Golden Visa offers long-term residency and family sponsorship. The application process is simplified for independent professionals.

title: A salute beyond death: MP to give guard of honour for organ, body donors
content: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav declared that individuals who donate their organs or bodies will receive a guard of honor during their final rites. This decision by the state government aims to encourage organ and body donation. Furthermore, the family members of these donors will be publicly honored on Republic Day or Independence Day as a mark of respect.

title: Meet Morgan Riddle: Stylish influencer behind Taylor Fritz
content: Morgan Riddle and Taylor Fritz's romance began during the pandemic, blossoming into a partnership that navigates the global tennis tour. Morgan, an influencer, is on a mission to revitalize tennis culture, while Taylor appreciates her support and visibility. Together, they face challenges and criticism, strengthening their bond and redefining athletic partnership in the modern era.

title: IND vs ENG: Gill gives major update on Bumrah - 'We'll take the call ...'
content: Ahead of the crucial second Test against England at Edgbaston, India grapple with key selection dilemmas. Jasprit Bumrah's potential inclusion remains uncertain, while captain Shubman Gill hints at strategic changes following their Leeds defeat. The team is considering bolstering their spin attack, possibly including Washington Sundar or Kuldeep Yadav alongside Ravindra Jadeja.

title: 'I was in the room': Jaishankar reveals what PM Modi told Vance when India pounded Pak
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar disclosed that during Operation Sindoor, US Vice President JD Vance warned PM Modi of a potential massive Pakistani assault. Modi remained resolute, signaling a strong response. Following India's retaliation and a subsequent call from Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Pakistan expressed willingness to engage in dialogue.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Tribunal says police not 'Aladdin ka Chirag'; blames RCB for chaos
content: The Central Administrative Tribunal (CAT) has indicated Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) bears primary responsibility for a stampede that killed 11 people. RCB announced victory celebrations without securing necessary police clearance, leading to a massive, unmanaged crowd.

title: MP girl butchered by jilted lover as hospital staff, patients watch helplessly
content: A shocking incident in Madhya Pradesh's Narsinghpur district has sparked outrage after a Class 12 student, Sandhya Chaudhary, was murdered inside the district hospital. The alleged perpetrator, Abhishek Koshti, a jilted lover, attacked her in broad daylight. Despite the presence of hospital staff, no one intervened. Koshti was arrested shortly after, confessing to the crime, citing suspicion of infidelity.

title: 'Saying I love you isn't sexual harassment': HC draws the line; clears man in Pocso case
content: The Nagpur bench of the Bombay High Court overturned the conviction of a man under the POSCO Act, stating that expressing 'I love you' doesn't automatically imply sexual intent. The court acquitted the man, who was accused of molesting a teenage girl by holding her hands and professing his love. The bench emphasized that additional evidence is needed to prove a sexual motive beyond the expression of affection.

title: IND vs ENG, 2nd Test: Stokes calls Pant ‘very dangerous’, says England ready to reset
content: Ahead of the crucial second Test at Edgbaston, England captain Ben Stokes has identified Rishabh Pant as a major threat, praising his explosive batting style. Despite holding a 1-0 lead, England remain grounded, naming an unchanged XI. India, meanwhile, aim to rebound after their Leeds defeat, with potential changes in their lineup, setting the stage for a high-stakes encounter.

title: Why Bobby Bonilla gets $1.2M every July: Mets' 2000 deferral deal backfires
content: MLB legend Bobby Bonilla receives $1,193,248.20 annually from the New York Mets every July 1st since 2011, a deal dating back to 2000. Bonilla deferred a $5.9 million payment, opting for yearly installments with an 8% interest, continuing until 2035 when he turns 72. The Mets, under Steve Cohen, playfully celebrate 'Bobby Bonilla Day'.

title: LeBron & Magic honor Parker: Sparks retire Candace’s jersey
content: Los Angeles Sparks honored Candace Parker by retiring her No. 3 jersey. The ceremony occurred during a game against Chicago Sky. LeBron James and Magic Johnson shared tributes. Parker became the third Sparks player to receive this honor. She reflected on her 13 years with the team. Her jersey will now remain in Sparks history.

title: IND vs ENG, 2nd Test predicted playing XI: Bumrah to be rested?
content: India fac a selection dilemma for the second Test against England at Edgbaston after their Leeds defeat. With Bumrah likely rested, Siraj, Akash Deep, and Krishna are likely to lead the pace attack. India are expected to include two spinners, with Jadeja a certainty and Washington Sundar favoured for his attacking edge. Nitish Reddy may replace Thakur for batting stability.

title: Tianwen-2 captures Earth and Moon: CNSA shares stunning images
content: China's Tianwen-2 probe has commenced its decade-long deep space mission, capturing a stunning image of Earth and the Moon from 590,000 kilometers away. Launched on May 29, the probe will collect samples from asteroid Kamo’oalewa by 2027 and later investigate comet 311P/PANSTARRS. This dual-target mission aims to unlock secrets about the origin of the Moon, water, and life.

title: Travel at your own risk: Bihar’s Rs100-crore road widened around trees - watch
content: A road widening project between Kanaudi and Irki in Jehanabad, near Patna, has hit a snag, leaving trees standing in the road's center. This poses a safety hazard for commuters. The road, now under the state RCD, awaits forest department clearance to remove the trees.

title: Inside Delhi's death dive squad:102 bodies pulled out from waterbodies this year
content: In Delhi's polluted waters, a team of 15 unsung divers tirelessly recover bodies, often without protective gear. So far in 2025, they've retrieved 102 corpses, facing hazards like toxic chemicals, snake bites, and treacherous currents. Descendants of Yamuna floodplain farmers, diving is their only livelihood after farming was banned due to pollution.

title: Car stolen in 60 seconds: Delhi gang breaks Creta window, hacks its security
content: Early morning in New Delhi, a Hyundai Creta was stolen in a mere 60 seconds. CCTV footage shows a group arriving in a car, breaking into the vehicle, and hacking its security system.

title: JAC Class 11 results 2025 declared at jacresults.com with 98.7% pass rate
content: The Jharkhand Academic Council (JAC) has declared the Class 11 Annual Examination results for 2025, with over 98.7% of students promoted. The results are available online at jacresults.com. A total of 344,987 students passed out of 349,476 who appeared. Alongside Class 11 results, JAC also announced the Model School Entrance and Intermediate Vocational Course examination results. Detailed statistics on enrolment, promotion, and absenteeism have been released, highlighting strong academic performance across Jharkhand.

title: Maharashtra assembly: Nana Patole climbs speaker's podium; gets suspended
content: Maharashtra assembly witnessed uproar. Congress MLA Nana Patole faced suspension. He protested against BJP leaders' comments on farmers. Opposition parties walked out. They boycotted proceedings. Patole vowed to continue raising farmer issues. He demanded action against BJP leaders Babanrao Lonikar and Manikrao Kokate. Other opposition leaders supported Patole. They criticized the government's handling of farmer concerns.

title: ‘Told me to sing for drunk friends’: Years of harassment by Kolkata rape accused
content: Monojit Mishra, also known as Mango, faces accusations of rape at a law college. Students report his disturbing behavior and constant stares. Eleven cases are registered against Monojit, including molestation charges. Victims describe incidents of harassment and threats. Pramit Mukhopadhyay, a co-accused, is allegedly involved in substance abuse. Students express fear and discomfort due to Monojit's actions.

title: Kareena Kapoor Khan gets candid on carrying the Kapoor legacy
content: Karisma Kapoor was the first one who came forward and rose to stardom from the great Kapoor family when it had been carried by only men from the royal family for a very long time. After she broke the tradition of male actors from the Kapoor family enjoying the stardom, her sister Kareena Kapoor also tried her luck in the industry.

title: 'Pushed her from 32nd floor after fight': Bhandup teen’s death mistaken as suicide
content: A 17-year-old's death in Bhandup, initially treated as suicide, is now a murder case. Police investigation revealed inconsistencies in the statement of the deceased's minor friend, the prime suspect. CCTV footage showed them together on the terrace.

title: Tamil Nadu custodial death: Vijay demands SIT probe
content: The death of Ajith Kumar, a temple guard, in police custody in Tamil Nadu has triggered widespread outrage, prompting actor Vijay to demand a special investigation. Evidence presented in court suggests Kumar was tortured, leading to the arrest of five police officers.

title: 'Sometimes the best moments...': Neeraj's heartwarming exchange with senior citizen - watch
content: Neeraj Chopra, during a Bengaluru stroll, shared a heartwarming moment with an admirer who expressed immense respect for his achievements. The interaction, captured in a reel, highlighted Chopra's humility. The Neeraj Chopra Classic, India's first international javelin competition, is set for July 5th at the Sree Kanteerava Stadium.

title: Teach those who backed Waqf legislation a lesson in polls: Owaisi
content: A.P. Chief Minister and Deputy Chief Minister, by supporting the Bill, have supported the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh

title: Expert urges Andhra Pradesh government to shelve Godavari-Banakacherla project
content: Calling it irrational and environmentally destructive, Bayyapu Reddy cautions that the project may take over 50 years to complete, with costs potentially rising to ₹8 lakh crore

title: 25,640 houses completed under PMAY in Nellore district
content: More than 7.21 lakh beneficiaries are receiving ration from 1,513 fair price shops in the district, says MP

title: Munnar to be a global Responsible Tourism destination by December
content: State govt. sanctions ₹50 lakh to undertake various branding programmes ahead of declaration. A slew of sustainable practices, including making it women-friendly, are on the cards

title: X, India spar over lawyer's 'Tom, Dick, and Harry' remark for government officials
content: Elon Musk’s X faces off with Indian government over content removal requests, sparking clash over content moderation

title: Tribal woman’s death: District Police Chief calls for action against government doctor for revealing post-mortem details
content: The doctor is accused for revealing the post-mortem details with the media before informing the police

title: Palaniswami wants CBI to probe the death of temple security guard
content: The AIADMK general secretary says 25 “lock-up deaths” have  occurred since the DMK came to power, and the National Human Rights Commission should probe these cases

title: INS Tamal commissioned in Kaliningrad, marks end of foreign-built Indian Navy warships
content: Last in the series of Russian-origin Project 1135.6 stealth frigates, Tamal to join Western Fleet; over a quarter of ship’s systems indigenously built

title: Several schemes implemented to help unorganised sector workers, says Lad
content: Labour minister and district-in-charge for Dharwad district Santosh Lad has said that the government had introduced several schemes towards providing social security to the workers of the unorganised sector, who constituted 90% of the working class in the country.

title: Thiruvananthapuram Corporation initiates mechanisms for rapid composting of organic waste
content: The other rapid composting system to be experimented will be carried through the crushing of organic waste to reduce their volume considerably.

title: Sivaganga custodial death case transferred to CBI; Stalin assures full cooperation in probe
content: The police force should act in a way that would instill confidence in the minds of the general public who approach the police hoping to get a solution to their grievances, Mr. Stalin said.

title: Eluru declared illicit liquor-free district
content: Intensify raids to ensure complete absence of illicit liquor in all areas of the district and to raise widespread public awareness, particularly by promoting the toll-free number 14405, says Collector

title: Tourist from Tamil Nadu killed, 10 injured as MUV falls into gorge in Munnar
content: The vehicle was carrying 11 people, including the driver, on the way to a resort after a sightseeing trip in the morning

title: Lokesh calls on loyal TDP worker’s family at  Armenipadu in Tirupati district, offers support
content: Promising to personally bear the educational expenses of Sheikh Allah Baksh’s two daughters, he says it is because of such steadfast workers the party withstood adversity

title: SC declines to intervene in spat between Thiruchendur temple Vidhayahar and State government over Kumbhabhishekam time
content: The Supreme Court ruled that the binding nature of opinion of the petitioner on fixing auspicious time will be decided in the civil court and not in writ jurisdiction

title: Viswas to open deaddiction centre for youth
content: The annual general body meeting of Viswas held here on Monday decided on the deaddition centre as part of its initiative to address the increasing use of drugs among youth.

title: Sources: Bucks waive Lillard, agree with Turner
content: The Bucks are waiving Damian Lillard and stretching the remaining $113M on his contract in order to acquire free agent center Myles Turner, sources told ESPN.

title: Waller unretiring as Dolphins trade for tight end
content: Darren Waller is coming out of retirement to play for the Dolphins, filling the team's void at the position after Jonnu Smith was traded to the Steelers on Monday.

title: Sources: SGA, OKC reach $285M supermax deal
content: NBA MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander has agreed to a four-year, $285 million supermax extension with the Thunder through the 2030-31 season, sources told ESPN.

title: Jake Paul ranked, eligible for shot at boxing title
content: Jake Paul is now ranked by the World Boxing Association and the social media influencer turned professional boxer is now eligible to challenge for cruiserweight division's WBA world title.

title: Lawsuit alleges Beasley had financial issues
content: Malik Beasley, an NBA player under investigation in a federal gambling probe, had financial issues and failed to pay back a $650,000 advance this year, according to a lawsuit.

title: Sources: Nuggets trading MPJ to Nets for Johnson
content: The Nuggets will trade Michael Porter Jr. and an unprotected 2032 first-round pick to the Nets for Cam Johnson, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Sources: Mavs agree to $13M deal with PG Russell
content: Free agent point guard D'Angelo Russell has agreed to a two-year, $13 million deal with the Dallas Mavericks, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Pegula handed early Wimbledon exit by No. 116
content: Italy's Elisabetta Cocciaretto registered the biggest win of her career when she knocked out American Jessica Pegula, the No. 3 seed, in less than an hour at Wimbledon.

title: Ibrahimovic: 'Messi plays with statues' at Miami
content: Zlatan Ibrahimovic defended Lionel Messi following Inter Miami's elimination from the FIFA Club World Cup and likened the superstar's teammates to "statues."

title: 💰Bobby Bonilla Day! Another $1.19M from Mets
content: Bobby Bo hasn't played for the Mets since 1999, but Tuesday he'll receive his annual hefty check from the team.

title: If a bunch of Americans transfer to better clubs, will it solve the USMNT's problems?
content: With the 2026 FIFA World Cup less than a year away, how important is it USMNT players transfer to better clubs or find clubs where they can play more?

title: USMNT’s grit, character are shining at Gold Cup and that will help at 2026 World Cup
content: This USMNT squad is learning so much about itself -- the biggest thing might be its grace under pressure.

title: Jalen Ramsey and Jonnu Smith for Minkah Fitzpatrick?!? We graded the Steelers-Dolphins blockbuster
content: Do Ramsey and Smith actually elevate Pittsburgh's roster? Did Miami maximize its return with Fitzpatrick? Let's size up the big trade.

title: Caitlin Clark's status, 3-pointers and fast-break points: Keys to Tuesday's Commissioner's Cup final
content: Minnesota has set the bar for consistency this season. Indiana? Not so much. And Caitlin Clark's status is uncertain.

title: WNBA Power Rankings: Aces, Valkyries, Mystics rise
content: The Aces have had an up-and-down season so far. Can they build on the momentum after defeating Phoenix?

title: What to know about expansion to Cleveland, Detroit and Philadelphia
content: Why is the WNBA expanding now? How will it impact the CBA and draft? What will more roster spots mean?

title: NFL players are busy reading these authors, from Tolstoy to Belichick
content: A.J. Brown made reading cool after his viral moment on the bench in January. But what are other NFL players reading this summer?

title: Inside the MLB draft journey for the sons of two former major leaguers
content: They share a home state, have ex-MLB outfielders for dads -- and took two very different paths to the top of the draft.

title: A new kind of mock draft: Our insiders make the picks for all 30 teams -- with trades!
content: Blockbuster trades and high-risk picks. ESPN's experts team up for the mock draft you didn't know you needed.

title: What's it like to defeat your former pro parent on the tennis court?
content: Shelton, Fritz, Ruud and several others at Wimbledon are kids of former pros. Was it a pivotal moment when they beat their parent? We found out.

title: Man City's old vulnerabilities exposed in Al Hilal upset
content: Pep Guardiola and Co. will have much to ponder ahead of the Premier League season after underdogs Al Hilal sensationally knocked Man City out of the Club World Cup.

title: Al Hilal eliminate Manchester City in CWC stunner
content: Saudi club Al Hilal pulled off a surprise upset on Monday, defeating Manchester City 4-3 in extra time in Orlando to advance to the quarterfinals of the Club World Cup.

title: Lautaro rips Inter after CWC exit: 'Fight, or leave'
content: Inter captain Lautaro Martínez sharply criticized his team's lack of commitment and performance after the 2-0 loss against Fluminense in the Club World Cup round of 16.

title: 'Big possibility' Mbappé plays for Madrid vs. Juve
content: Kylian Mbappé is close to making his FIFA Club World Cup debut in Real Madrid's round of 16 clash against Juventus at the Club World Cup, with coach Xabi Alonso saying it is a "big possibility" that the forward will be fit to play.

title: FIFPRO: U.S. temps a concern for '26 World Cup
content: FIFPRO has raised concerns over the effect of intense heat during the FIFA Club World Cup in the United States by saying that two games -- Paris Saint-Germain-Atlético Madrid and Chelsea-Esperance -- should have been postponed due to extreme heat.

title: Torrent: Time with Pep key vs. 'superior' Dortmund
content: Monterrey head coach Domenec Torrent admitted his team faces a superior opponent in Borussia Dortmund in the Club World Cup round of 16 on Tuesday night at Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta, but he expects the Liga MX side to compete well.

title: Neymar to play until 'I can no longer perform'
content: Brazil forward Neymar has said he will continue playing football until he can 'no longer perform' as he wants to.

title: Liverpool's Hinds leaves club amid Arsenal talks
content: Liverpool Women have confirmed vice-captain Taylor Hinds has decided to leave the club, with a source telling ESPN she is in talks with Arsenal.

title: Premier League kit rankings: Every new jersey released so far
content: Why should you have to wait until all of the Premier League kits are out before you see them ranked? Here's every 2025-26 jersey that's been released.

title: The Mock Draft project: 2025's most wanted fantasy football picks
content: We put our experts through the paces of multiple mock drafts to derive the ultimate average draft positions for 2025.

title: What the trade to Steelers means for Jonnu Smith's value
content: Smith had a breakout year in Miami last season. Will he do it again after being traded to the Steelers?

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Is Jake Paul finally in the cruiserweight top 10?
content: Jake Paul took one more step toward challenging for his first world title. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: 'This is a startup': Meet the man in charge of policing the new world of college sports
content: Overseeing athlete payments in college sports may seem like a thankless, nearly impossible job. But Bryan Seeley thinks he's up to the task.

title: Married in Manhattan: Zach Wilson ties knot with Nicolette Dellanno in New York
content: Quarterback Zach Wilson got married over the weekend to Nicolette Dellanno a year after their engagement.

title: 2026 NFL mock draft: Miller's early projections for the first round, including four QBs
content: What might the Browns and Rams do with their first-rounders? How many QBs could go on Day 1? Here's Matt Miller's early look at the 2026 draft.

title: Bottas? Pérez? Which drivers could Cadillac sign ahead of 2026 F1 debut?
content: Eight months out from its F1 debut, Cadillac doesn't have a driver lineup yet. Who could we see in the American machines?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Al Nassr tracking PSG's Fabián Ruiz
content: Paris Saint-Germain midfielder Fabián Ruiz is on the radar of Manchester United and Saudi Arabian side Al Nassr. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Video: Shopkeeper Refuses To Speak Marathi, MNS Workers Rain Slaps On Him
content: A shopkeeper was assaulted by Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) workers in Thane for asking them why speaking in Marathi should be compulsory.

title: US Senate Approves Trump's Divisive "One Big Beautiful Bill"
content: The Republican-led US Senate approved Donald Trump's flagship spending bill Tuesday after a marathon voting session on the deeply unpopular package, set to slash social welfare programs and add an eye-watering $3 trillion to the national debt.

title: "Have Faith In Law": Odisha Civic Official On Being Assaulted In Office
content: Additional Commissioner of the Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation has said that he was "brutally attacked" by five-six people while he was in his office and that an FIR has been lodged.

title: Rajasthan 'Tantrik' Sent To Police Custody For Kidnapping, Raping Minor Girl
content: A self-proclaimed occultist (tantrik) was remanded to police custody in Jhalawar district after he allegedly abducted and raped a minor girl for over three days, police said.

title: Tamil Nadu's Most Wanted Terrorist Abubacker Siddique Arrested After 30 Years
content: Tamil Nadu Police arrested Abubacker Siddique, the state's most wanted terrorist, from a remote hideout in Andhra Pradesh after nearly three decades on the run.

title: Odisha Schoolgirl Raped With Hands, Legs Tied, 1 Arrested
content: A female student of class 7 was raped allegedly by a distant relative in Odisha's Ganjam district, police said.

title: "Even Murderer Will Not Attack Like This": Madras High Court On Tamil Nadu Custodial Death
content: Chief Minister MK Stalin has ordered that the case be transferred to the Central Bureau of Investigation.

title: "Live 200 Years": Ramdev In Anti-Ageing Debate After Shefali Jariwala Death
content: Baba Ramdev's comments come against the backdrop of a debate over the consumption of anti-ageing medications after the untimely death of actor Shefali Jariwala.

title: Kolkata Student Given Inhaler So She Could Be Raped: Lawyer In Court
content: The Kolkata rape survivor was not given an inhaler when she suffered a panic attack out of concern for her, but so she could recover and be brutalised, the public prosecutor has informed a court in the city.

title: Delhi Cloud Seeding Trials Green Lit: When, Where They Will Be Conducted
content: Delhi is set to witness its first-ever cloud seeding flights starting this August after the Directorate General of Civil Aviation granted final approval for airborne trials.

title: 3 Men Drown While Bathing In Waterfall In Madhya Pradesh's Panna
content: The bodies of three youngsters were retrieved from Brihaspati Kund waterfall, a popular picnic spot in Panna district of Madhya Pradesh, where they had gone two days ago, an official said on Tuesday.

title: US Stocks Fall From Records As Tesla Sinks On Musk-Trump Row
content: Wall Street stocks retreated from records early Tuesday while Tesla sank as President Donald Trump's sweeping tax cut bill faced hurdles in Congress and renewed criticism from Elon Musk.

title: Delhi Court To Pass Order On Bail Of Parliament Security Breach Accused Tomorrow
content: The Delhi High Court would on July 2 decide the bail pleas of two accused persons in the December 2023 Parliament security breach case.

title: World Will Have To Learn To Live With Heatwaves Says UN
content: The world will have to learn to live with heatwaves, the United Nations' weather and climate agency said Tuesday, as much of Europe roasted in high summer temperatures.

title: France Shuts Schools, Top Floor Of Eiffel Tower, As Heatwave Grips Europe
content: Some 1,350 schools will be fully or partially closed due to the heat, up significantly from around 200 on Monday. The top floor of the Eiffel Tower will be closed on Tuesday and Wednesday, with visitors advised to drink plenty of water.

title: German Weather Station Records Driest First Half Of Year In 13 Decades
content: A weather station in Potsdam, Germany, one of the world's oldest, has recorded the driest first half of a year since measurements began more than 130 years ago, according to the Potsdam Institute for Climate Impact Research (PIK).

title: BJP Claims Bengal Minister Called Kolkata Rape 'Small Incident', He Denies
content: A West Bengal minister's statement that any incident that happens in the state is blown out of proportion has been used by the BJP to attack the Trinamool Congress and claim that he was talking about the rape of the law student in Kolkata last week.

title: Why Donald Trump Is 'Looking Into' Deporting Elon Musk
content: After billionaire Elon Musk slammed US President Donald Trump's flagship spending bill, the latter said he could consider deporting Musk. "I don't know. We'll have to take a look," Trump told reporters at the White House.

title: DK Shivakumar Sends Notice To MLA Who Pushed For Him To Be Chief Minister
content: Putting out one fire. Then another. Then yet another. That appears to be the case in the Karnataka Congress amid a renewed push for a leadership change. The party, however, maintains all's well.
